During Research
 
The main data management task during the research process is to store data safely with regular backups. Storing data solely on a local harddisk, laptop or USB stick is very risky and not recommended as storage media may deteriorate, could be lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed. Backups should be performed regularly. Automatic backups are better than manual ones which you might forget. Also verify that backups are working, and that you have access to these files.
 
 
Numerous MPDL services are available to Max Planck researchers and – upon invitation – their external collaborators. Additional (more discipline-specific) ones may exist at individual institutes.
